intro: Senecio fraudulentus, commonly known as the false ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in shrublands and grasslands. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Senecio fraudulentus is not typically cultivated but can be found in wild areas where it thrives in arid conditions.
